entries.title: THREE QUARTETS (nos. 7 to 9) for clarinet, flute, horn and bassoon

first_edition.title: Trois quatuors pour flûte, clarinette, cor et basson extraits des oeuvres de Boccherini dédiés à Monsieur Camille Canuel, Avocat, par Othon Van den Broek pensionnaire de la Chapelle du Roi et de l'Académie Royale de musique, Livre 3ème, à Paris, chez Bouillon, rue du Doyenné nº 12

entries.notes: None of these movements corresponds to any movement of a known work by Boccherini. It is impossible to reach any conclusion as to the origin of these arrangements. Were they derived by Van den Broek from manuscripts or editions of works by Boccherini—or falsely attributed to Boccherini—which are unknown to us? Or did he perhaps wish to give the prestige of Boccherini's name to works of his own production? In any case, it may be remarked that the musical value of this third collection is very inferior to that of the two preceding books (Nos. 262 and 263).

partial_notes: This entry contains arrangements of questionable authenticity by Othon Van den Broek. The footnote mentions Mademoiselle Annick Devriès' research assistance and references to Sieber editions.
